intro: Lastrea densiloba, commonly known as the dense-loba cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiny stems that are often covered in a layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its succulent nature allows it to store water efficiently, adapting to arid environments. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
